thread.title: Willie Young: I'll 'do whatever my coaches ask'
thread.title_full: Willie Young: I'll 'do whatever my coaches ask' | Chicago Sun-Times

title: Willie Young: I'll 'do whatever my coaches ask'
text:
After being a healthy scratch in Seattle, watching Jared Allen get dealt and then playing 18 snaps against the Raiders, Willie Young has a scouting report on his own play.
“Got after the quarterback a couple times,” the Bears’ defensive end-turned-outside linebacker said Wednesday at Halas Hall. “Won my one-on-one rushes, made the most of my opportunities.
“It’s all about consistency now.”
Young had never played outside linebacker until, following Achilles tendon surgery, he began the conversion to fit into Vic Fangio’s 3-4 defense. Allen tried the same switch, but was eventually traded so he could return to his familiar end spot.
Could that happen to Young, too?
A report Sunday night indicated that, once Allen was dealt, Young asked the Bears for a trade. Asked to clarify Wednesday, Young didn’t.
“Really just no comment on it, for real,” he said. ”I’m just here to be a player, man, and do whatever my coaches ask.
“It’s all good. I’m just here to do what my coach is asking me and to be a professional.”
Young had three tackles and two quarterback hurries against the Raiders, but has yet to record a sack. He set a career high last season with 10.
The Chiefs, though, have allowed an NFL-high 19 sacks. Coach Andy Reid shouldered some of the blame, saying that he needed to scheme his way around the pressure.
“Just making sure that I’m giving him plays that he can get the ball out on time,” he said. “That’s the No. 1 thing. I’ve got to do a better job with that.”
If anyone can use the sack, it’s Young.
“That’s definitely not bad news,” Young said. “It just means we gotta be sharp. If you come out and lay down for anybody they’re going to run you over.
“We still have to come to play, week in and week out.”
